an7.22:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.
an7.22:4.3: Now at that time King Ajātasattu Vedehiputta of Māgadha wanted to invade the Vajjis.
an7.22:4.5: “I will wipe out these Vajjis, so mighty and powerful! I will destroy them, and lay ruin and devastation upon them!”
an7.22:5.1: And then King Ajātasattu addressed Vassakāra the brahmin minister of Māgadha:
an7.22:5.3: and in my name bow with your head to his feet. Ask him if he is healthy and well, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.
an7.22:5.6: ‘Sir, King Ajātasattu Vedehiputta of Māgadha wants to invade the Vajjis.
an7.22:5.8: “I will wipe out these Vajjis, so mighty and powerful! I will destroy them, and lay ruin and devastation upon them!”’
an7.22:5.9: Remember well how the Buddha answers and tell it to me.
an7.22:5.10: For Realized Ones say nothing that is not so.”
an7.22:6.1: “Yes, sir,” Vassako replied. He went to the Buddha,
an7.22:6.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
an7.22:6.5: “Master Gotama, King Ajātasattu bows with his head to your feet. He asks if you are healthy and well, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.
an7.22:6.6: King Ajātasattu wants to invade the Vajjis.
an7.22:6.8: ‘I will wipe out these Vajjis, so mighty and powerful! I will destroy them, and lay ruin and devastation upon them!’”
an7.22:7.1: Now at that time Venerable Ānanda was standing behind the Buddha fanning him.
an7.22:7.2: Then the Buddha said to him:
an7.22:7.4: the Vajjis meet frequently and have many meetings?”
an7.22:7.7: “As long as the Vajjis meet frequently and have many meetings,
an7.22:7.8: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.22:8.2: the Vajjis meet in harmony, leave in harmony, and carry on their business in harmony?”
an7.22:8.5: “As long as the Vajjis meet in harmony, leave in harmony, and carry on their business in harmony,
an7.22:8.6: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.22:9.2: the Vajjis don’t make new decrees or abolish existing decrees, but undertake and follow the ancient Vajjian principles as they have been decreed?”
an7.22:9.5: “As long as the Vajjis don’t make new decrees or abolish existing decrees, but undertake and follow the ancient Vajjian principles as they have been decreed,
an7.22:9.6: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.22:10.2: the Vajjis honor, respect, esteem, and venerate Vajjian elders, and think them worth listening to?”
an7.22:10.5: “As long as the Vajjis honor, respect, esteem, and venerate Vajjian elders, and think them worth listening to,
an7.22:10.6: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.22:11.2: the Vajjians don’t rape or abduct women or girls from their families and force them to live with them?”
an7.22:11.5: “As long as the Vajjians don’t rape or abduct women or girls from their families and force them to live with them,
an7.22:11.6: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.22:12.2: the Vajjis honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the Vajjian shrines, whether inner or outer, not neglecting the proper spirit-offerings that were given and made in the past?”
an7.22:12.5: “As long as the Vajjis honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the Vajjian shrines, whether inner or outer, not neglecting the proper spirit-offerings that were given and made in the past,
an7.22:12.6: they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.22:13.2: the Vajjis arrange for proper protection, shelter, and security for perfected ones, so that
an7.22:13.3: more perfected ones might come to the realm and those already here may live in comfort,
an7.22:13.7: “As long as the Vajjis arrange for proper protection, shelter, and security for perfected ones, so that
an7.22:13.8: more perfected ones might come to the realm and those already here may live in comfort,
an7.22:13.9: they can expect growth, not decline.”
an7.22:14.1: Then the Buddha said to Vassakāra:
an7.22:14.2: “Brahmin, this one time I was staying near Vesālī at the Sarandada woodland shrine.
an7.22:14.3: There I taught the Vajjis these seven that ensure you don’t decline.
an7.22:14.4: As long as these seven principles that ensure you don’t decline last among the Vajjians, and as long as the Vajjians are seen following them,
an7.22:14.5: they can expect growth, not decline.”
an7.22:15.1: “Master Gotama, if the Vajjis follow even a single one of these principles they can expect growth, not decline.
an7.22:15.2: How much more so all seven!
an7.22:15.3: King Ajātasattu cannot defeat the Vajjis in war, unless by diplomacy or by sowing dissension.
an7.22:15.4: Well, now, Master Gotama, I must go. I have many duties, and much to do.”
an7.22:15.6: Then Vassakāra the brahmin, having approved and agreed with what the Buddha said, got up from his seat and left.
